<<<code>>>: public String convertStreamToString(InputStream is) throws IOException {
InputStreamReader isr = new InputStreamReader(is);
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(isr);
StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
String line = null;
while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
sb.append(line + "\n");
}
return sb.toString();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads the InputStream line by line and converts it to a String using an InputStreamReader and a BufferedReader. It then appends each line to a StringBuilder and returns the final string. This way, you can handle large amounts of data efficiently without having to read the entire stream into memory at once.
